summary: This document is a series of email updates regarding the psychological and medical observation of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 28-29, 2019. It details his complaints of numbness, sleep issues, and his request to avoid returning to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), with staff determining he is psychologically stable and planning his return to SHU.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate being observed; he complains of numbness in his right arm and neck, inability to sleep due to sleep apnea and a noisy toilet, and requests to stay in a 'safe' area rather than return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Epstein's Medical and Psychological Observation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is observed in the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He complains of numbness in his right arm and neck, and a running toilet noise preventing sleep. Medical staff assess him.

events.title: Decision to Return Epstein to SHU
events.description: Prison psychologists and staff communicate that Epstein is psychologically stable and will be returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) after receiving his CPAP machine for sleep apnea.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 28-29, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was under psychological observation in the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein complained of numbness in his right arm and neck, and attributed potential memory impairment to his sleep apnea.
Epstein requested to remain in a 'safe' area and not return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), but staff determined he was psychologically stable and planned his return.
Epstein was scheduled to receive a CPAP machine to treat his sleep apnea on July 29, 2019.
The document records internal prison communications about managing Epstein's health and security status shortly before his death.
